results.title: Vertigo
results.brief_description: Arguably one of Hitchcock’s greatest films, “Vertigo” is a tense and riveting film about obsession, desire and betrayal. James Stewart plays a cop, with a fear of heights, who is hired to keep an eye on the wife (Kim Novak) of an old friend. He falls in love with her and her tragic death haunts him until he meets another woman who reminds him of her. His obsession with remodelling his new love into the image of the dead woman leads him further and further into a sinister nightmare world in which nothing and no-one is who they seem. With Barbara Bel Geddes and with ravishing production credits. Based on “D’Entre les Mortes” by Pierre Boileau and Thomas Narcejac.

results.title: Vertical limit [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Lloyd Phillips, Robert King and Martin Campbell
results.brief_description: Peter Garrett (Chris O’Donnell) and his sister Annie (Robin Tunney) lost their father to a tragic rock climbing accident, an accident that left Peter having to cut his father free from a rope they were all clinging to in order to save his and Annie’s lives. Years later, Annie has become a world class mountain climber who is hired by Elliot Vaughn to help him climb K2, the second highest peak in the world. Peter has given up climbing to become a nature photographer. In the middle of the climb bad weather strikes and Elliot, Annie and their crew find themselves trapped by an avalanche. Peter, working on an assignment near K2 organizes a rescue mission to help Annie and the other climbers before they run out of air.

results.title: Veronika Voss
results.creator_credit: Laura Film, Tango, Rialto Film, Trio, Maran Film, Thomas Schuhly and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: Stylish and harshly beautiful, with its virtuoso camerawork and stark black and white cinematography, this portrait of corruption - of both Germany and the UFA star system - centres on the decline into madness and drug addiction of a once famous, now faded film star. Though reminiscent in theme of Billy wilders “Sunset boulevard”, director Fassbinders fascination with the modes of melodrama evidenced in the Hollywood works of Douglas Sirk predominates. This, his penultimate film, can be seen as the final piece in a trilogy about post-war Germany (along with “The Marriage of Maria Braun” and “Lola”). The actual story is loosely based on the life of Sybille Schmitz (“Vampyr”,1932 and “Titanic, 1943) a German actress who died in mysterious circumstances in 1955.

results.title: Varsity blues
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Tova Laiter, Mike Tollin and Brian Robbins
results.brief_description: Eager to prove he is more than just another soap star, James Van Der Beek agreed to the title role of Jonathan “Mox” Moxton in this coming of age film set in Texas. Mox is a reluctant gridiron fullback in the West Canaan Coyotes who discovers his brilliance for the game after being called in to substitute for injured star player Lance Harbor (Paul Walker). Mox is not thrilled at being pushed into the limelight as it means undue attention from masochistic Coach Kilmer (Jon Voight) - eager to win the 23rd district trophy, increased pressure from his father who is using Mox to live out his own unfulfilled sporting aspirations, and grief from his girlfriend who says that Mox is deluding himself by being a football hero. Things come to a head on the eve of the final when Mox is blackmailed by Coach Kilmer into play the game “his way” or face the prospect of remaining in their one horse town when he sabotages Mox’s chance at taking up his university offer. Cast also includes Ron Lester, Scott Caan, Ali Larter and Amy Smart.

results.title: Vanya on 42nd Street
results.creator_credit: Laura Pels Productions, New Media Finance, Fred Berner and Louis Malle
results.brief_description: In the late 80s New York theatre director Andre Gregory spent several years staging, in ad-hoc spaces, but with top-notch actors, a new version of Anton Chekhov’s “Uncle Vanya”, scripted by David Mamet (famed playwright and director of State and Main, The Winslow Boy, The Spanish Prisoner). Intrigued by the processes, director Louis Malle (in what was to be his last film) decided to film the actors at rehearsal in a dilapidated theatre. As played by Wallace Shawn, the titular Vanya is an embittered keeper of a rural Russian estate; owned by the vaunted husband of his late sister, Serybryakov is an intellectual who arrives with his young, alluring wife, Yelena; this causes the protagonists, including Serybryakov’s plain, lovelorn daughter, Sonya, and the idealistic Dr Astrov, to evaluate the meaning of their lives. The results of this set-up are a powerful rendition of “Vanya”, boasting fine performances; the parred back setting allows for an accentuation on the language and cadence of the Mamet’s text, placing an emphasis on the themes that dominate “Vanya” - regret, loneliness, thwarted love and anguish. But the lines between ‘reality’ and ‘the play’ are not sufficiently blurred (as suggested by several enraptured reviewers) to produce truly revelatory moments pertaining to life and art. What does remain however is an engrossing two hours of Chekhov. Cast includes: Wallace Shawn, Julianne Moore, Larry Pine, Brooke Smith, Lynn Cohen, Phoebe Brand, Madhur Jaffrey and George Gaynes.

results.title: Up in arms
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Samuel Goldwyn and Elliott Nugent
results.brief_description: Wartime musical comedy about a hypochondriac elevator operator who, after being drafted into the Army, becomes a surprise hero. Infatuated with nurse Mary, Danny Weems (Danny Kaye) tries to set up his friend Joe with her friend and fellow nurse Virginia, (Dinah Shore) but Virginia is crazy about Danny and Joe and Mary fall for each other. After all four enter the Army, Danny, Joe, and Virginia discover they are being transported to the South Pacific aboard the same ship. Danny accidentally causes Mary to be smuggled aboard their ship, and spends much of the film trying to keep her hidden from the colonel. When the troops finally land, Danny is thrown in the brig, where Japanese soldiers first kidnap him and then are tricked into capture by Danny. He returns to Virginia and acclaim as a hero. Cast also includes Dana Andrews, Constance Dowling. the Goldwyn Girls.

results.title: Up close & personal (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Jon Avnet, David Nicksay and Jordan Kerner
results.brief_description: From humble beginnings, Sally Atwater (Michelle Pfeiffer) is about to hit the big time. Arriving from a trailer park in Nevada, an overeager and overdressed weather girl, she makes a disastrous debut on national television. All is not lost however as her passion for the job captures the eye of the experienced, and handsome newsman, Warren Justice (Robert Redford). With Warren’s help Sally is transformed, Pygmalian style, into a popular and respected journalist. Along the way romance develops, but this is threatened by Sally’s newfound success and they must find a balance between love and their successful careers. Cast includes Stockard Channing, Joe Mantegna and Kate Nelligan.

results.title: Unzipped
results.creator_credit: Hachette Fillpacchi Productions, Michael Alden and Douglas Keeve
results.brief_description: Isaac Mizrahi is a talented New York fashion designer, who, after receiving negative reviews for his 1994 Spring collection, is in need of a successful season. This documentary tracks the evolution of Mizrahi’s next collection - from fledging moments of inspiration to final parade. “Unzipped” is a frank examination of the fashion industry at work - the superficiality, demands, personalities, exhaustion, frustrations, setbacks, camaraderie and creativity of it all. Supermodels take centre stage and the precociousness of this elite group is in evident abundance. Mizrahi seeks guidance from a diverse range of sources (including a ouija board) as he aims to evoke the look and style of an Inuit, mixed with 1950s cheesecake aesthetic, meets Mary Tyler Moore. Mizrahi’s mother is interviewed and gives insights into her son’s precocious talent, recognised and nurtured by her. Directed by Douglas Keeve, “Unzipped” is a candid examination of the sparks that fly when creative urges seek to ally financial interest. Features appearances from Naomi Campbell, Linda Evangelista, Cindy Crawford, Helena Christensen, Richard Gere, Eartha Kitt, Sandra Bernhard and Kate Moss. Winner of the Audience Award at the 1995 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Universal soldier
results.creator_credit: Corolco Pictures, Allen Shapiro, Craig Baumgarten, Joel B Michaels and Roland Emmerich
results.brief_description: Vietnam soldiers Luc Devreaux (Jean-Claude Van Damme), and Andrew Scott (Dolph Lundgren) are killed in combat. Their bodies are used in a secret government experiment of mixing man with machine. The two were sworn enemies in life and the experiment was supposed to have erased all memories but they rediscover the fierce hate between them as two fighting machines battle one another to the death. Also starring Ally Walker, Ed O’Ross and Jerry Orbach. This video contains 11 minutes of extra footage not screened in cinemas.

results.title: Unidentified flying oddball
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ron Miller and Russ Mayberry
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Twain’s ‘A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court’ this Disney film version provides a new twist to the story by setting it in today’s space age. NASA scientist Tom Trimble (Dennis Dugan) and his robot clone accidentally find themselves travelling back in time to the land of merry England and the court of King Arthur (Kenneth More). Here Trimble encounters the lovely Alisande (Sheila White), King Arthur’s enemy the evil knight Sir Mordred (Jim Dale), and Merlin (Ron Moody) the Court’s magician. Will Trimble be drawn into Sir Mordred’s evil plot to oust King Arthur or will he save the day and in doing so stop history from being changed forever? Cast includes John Le Mesurier as Sir Gawain.
